abstract: Motorola’s reversal of fortunes has been striking, with a global market share of the cellular phone market below 10 percent, a plunge from 22 percent in 2006.
snippet: Motorola’s reversal of fortunes has been striking, with a global market share of the cellular phone market below 10 percent, a plunge from 22 percent in 2006.
lead_paragraph: Neeraj Choubey has not worked at the troubled cellphone maker Motorola for seven years. But from the number of calls and e-mail messages Mr. Choubey, a Silicon Valley venture capitalist, has gotten in recent weeks, you would think he had never left his old colleagues.

headline.main: Cellphone Pioneer Struggles to Stay Relevant
headline.print_headline: Cellphone Pioneer Struggles to Stay Relevant
